sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: A metal sphere has a diameter of 10 cm. Calculate the volume of the sphere, correct to two decimal places.
message_2:
To calculate the volume of a sphere, we use the formula:

Volume = (4/3) × π × r^3

where r is the radius of the sphere.

Given that the diameter of the sphere is 10 cm, the radius (r) is half of the diameter:

r = 10 cm / 2 = 5 cm

Now, we can plug the radius into the formula:

Volume = (4/3) × π × (5 cm)^3
Volume = (4/3) × π × 125 cm^3
Volume = 4 × π × 41.67 cm^3 (rounded to two decimal places)
Volume ≈ 4 × 3.14 × 41.67 cm^3
Volume ≈ 12.56 × 41.67 cm^3
Volume ≈ 523.33 cm^3

So, the volume of the sphere is approximately 523.33 cubic centimeters, correct to two decimal places.
